meanings.sent1: The ineradicability of his love for animals was evident in the way he cared for every stray he found.
meanings.sent2: The ineradicability of the stain on the carpet made her realize she needed professional help to clean it.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the ineradicability of the marker doodle on the wall made it a permanent part of the room's decor.
meanings.sent4: The ineradicability of her fear of spiders was like a shadow that followed her everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The ineradicability of the memory haunted him like a ghost, never fading with time.

meanings.definition: The state of being impossible to eradicate or remove.
meanings.sent1: The ineradicability of the weed in the garden frustrated the gardener's attempts to remove it.
meanings.sent2: The ineradicability of the virus in the system required a complete overhaul of the computer.
meanings.sent3: The ineradicability of the gum stuck to his shoe made him walk funny, much to the amusement of onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The ineradicability of the rumor spread through the school like wildfire, impossible to stop.
meanings.sent5: The ineradicability of the old graffiti on the wall served as a reminder of the building's history.
